meanings.definition: A wooden paneling on the lower part of the walls of a room.
meanings.sent1: The wainscot in the dining room added a touch of elegance to the space.
meanings.sent2: The old house had beautiful wainscot that showcased intricate craftsmanship.
meanings.sent3: As the cat chased a mouse, it leaped onto the wainscot, mistaking it for a hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: The wainscot stood like a silent guardian, protecting the walls from scuff marks.
meanings.sent5: The wainscot, with its smooth finish, gleamed in the sunlight, brightening the room.

meanings.definition: To line or panel with wood.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter will wainscot the study with oak panels for a classic look.
meanings.sent2: She decided to wainscot the kitchen walls to give them a rustic charm.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to wainscot its tree trunk with twigs, attempting a wooden disguise.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to wainscot the room, surrounding us with a sense of warmth and comfort.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully wainscoted the gallery walls, transforming the space into a wooden wonderland.
